title: How to Baste Fabric

steps.headline: Thread a needle and tie a knot in the thread.
Hold your fabric together and start sewing with a "running" stitch.
steps.description: Nothing fancy here, just up, down, up down. You can reposition your fabric between stitches if necessary and do any small tweaking as you go.

steps.headline: Remove any basting stitches when you are satisfied with the permanent seam.
Set your stitch length to its longest setting.
Sew slowly, making any adjustments as you go.
Adjust the stitch length to normal (usually 1.5 - 2.5 mm) and sew the "permanent" seam.
Remove any basting which shows on the exterior of the garment.

text: By Hand Thread a needle and tie a knot in the thread.  Hold your fabric together and start sewing with a "running" stitch. Nothing fancy here, just up, down, up down. You can reposition your fabric between stitches if necessary and do any small tweaking as you go. Remove any basting stitches when you are satisfied with the permanent seam.  By Machine Set your stitch length to its longest setting.  Pin carefully.  Sew slowly, making any adjustments as you go.  Check for fit or shape.  Adjust the stitch length to normal (usually 1.5 - 2.5 mm) and sew the "permanent" seam.  Remove any basting which shows on the exterior of the garment.
